title: SHAMELESS Remainers join forces in demand for second referendum on BBC panel show
text:
SHAMELESS Remainers join forces in demand for second referendum on BBC panel show SHAMELESS Remainers join forces in demand for second referendum on BBC panel show CAROLINE LUCAS and Shabana Mahmood joined forces on a BBC panel show as they launched an angry tirade at the Prime Minister over Brexit. PUBLISHED: 22:57, Fri, Mar 24, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:59, Fri, Mar 24, 2017 
Both the Green Party and Labour Party MPs launched astonishing attacks on Theresa May for pursuing a “hard-Brexit”. 
Speaking on BBC Radio 4’s Any Questions? , the politicians joined in targeting the PM days before she plans to trigger Article 50 . 
Mrs May is expected to begin the formal process of Brexit on March 29 and cut ties with the Brussels bloc. 
Ms Lucas began the explosive debate by claiming that the UK should have another referendum at the end of the Brexit process. 
She said: “I think it is right that there should be a referendum, a ratification referendum at the end of this process. GETTY•BBC Caroline Lucas and Shabana Mahmood targeted the PM from her hard-Brexit plan Related articles Sir Malcolm Rifkind: We have no choice but to pay the Brexit Bill 
“What we know so far is that the British public by a majority want to leave the EU, that is clear. 
“What is not clear is what the destination is going to be and what really worries me is [the way] in which the Prime Minister has morphed what was a small majority in favour of leaving the EU into what she is perceiving as an overwhelming mandate for the most extreme Brexit possibly imaginable. 
“Out of the single market, out of the customs union. No freedom of movement, no social environmental support.” 
The Labour MP Shabana Mahmood then backed up Ms Lucas by mocking the Prime Minister for pursuing a hard-Brexit. I think when the country see’s hard-Brexit in reality, people will be asking a lot more questions Shabana Mahmood 
She said: “The only thing that I would add is that if the decision had been the other way you can’t imagine a scenario in which Brexiteers would have accepted hard-Remain. 
“You know, Eurozone, Schengen, all of the opt-pouts becoming opt-ins. That would have never have happened. 
“The Government does have a mandate to carry out Brexit, I will support that, but they do not have a mandate for hard-Brexit.” 
Mrs May has reiterated that she will exit Britain from the single market and attempt to agree a trade deal with the EU during the two-year Brexit process. 
The decision from the UK to leave the European block upset the President of the European Commission who described Brexit as a “tragedy”. Fishermen need Brexit now!
